de.mixedfx.gui.panes

Class SuperPane

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.StackPane
              • de.mixedfx.gui.panes.SuperPane
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class SuperPane
extends javafx.scene.layout.StackPane

    This class can be instantiated to get an advanced very flexible and lightweight pane.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SuperPane(javafx.scene.Node content)
      You can get the SuperPane from getMySP(Node) Architecture: 1st layer: 1 time Content 1 layer: LoadScreen
      n layer: 0-n times Dialogue
      n layer: 0-n times SplashScreen Lifecycle: Content is saved at instantiation Others are only part of the object and therefore the scene graph as long as they are visible The LoadScreen is null = No LoadScreen is shown while loading...
      SuperPane(javafx.scene.Node content, javafx.scene.Node loadScreen)
      See also SuperPane(Node)

    • Constructor Detail

      • SuperPane

        public SuperPane(javafx.scene.Node content,
                 javafx.scene.Node loadScreen)
        See also SuperPane(Node)
        Parameters:
        content -
        loadScreen - Can be a Dynamic to be informed about its lifecycle. The Load Screen is not part of the scene graph until {SuperPane load(Task) is called.

      • SuperPane

        public SuperPane(javafx.scene.Node content)

        You can get the SuperPane from getMySP(Node)

        Architecture:
        1. 1st layer: 1 time Content
        2. 1 layer: LoadScreen
          n layer: 0-n times Dialogue
          n layer: 0-n times SplashScreen
        Lifecycle:
        1. Content is saved at instantiation
        2. Others are only part of the object and therefore the scene graph as long as they are visible
        The LoadScreen is null = No LoadScreen is shown while loading...
        Parameters:
        content - The content which shall be shown.

    • Method Detail

      • getMySP

        public static final SuperPane getMySP(javafx.scene.Node content)
        Retrieves and returns the first found parent SuperPane (which doesn't have to be the direct parent node).
        Parameters:
        content -
        Returns:
        Returns the SuperPane requested or returns null if there is no SuperPane as (direct or indirect) parent

      • setBackground

        public void setBackground(javafx.scene.Node background)
        Sets the Background.
        Parameters:
        background - In contrast to Region.setBackground(javafx.scene.layout.Background) this can be any Node.

      • load

        public void load(javafx.concurrent.Task<?> task)
        Loads a task asynchronously and shows a stopping task animation as an overlay if the task is running longer than taskMaxParallel. In each case the content is unclickable for the time. Doesn't have to be called via FXThread.
        Parameters:
        task - The task which shall be executed. Maybe it is not executed immediately because more than taskMaxParallel are running in parallel. But the Load Screen is shown all over the time.

      • openDialogue

        public void openDialogue(javafx.scene.Node dialogue)
        Opens a new dialogue. Works if a dialogue is opened or not.

      • closeDialogue

        public void closeDialogue(javafx.scene.Node dialogue)

      • openDynamic

        public void openDynamic(javafx.scene.Node dynamic)

        Opens a Dynamic.

        Only if the direct node implements Dynamic it will be informed about the start (after it was added to the scene graph).

        Parameters:
        dynamic - The node (if Dynamic it will be informed) which shall be shown on top of the SuperPane

      • closeDynamic

        public void closeDynamic(javafx.scene.Node dynamic)
        Closes a Dynamic or if a parent was added to this SuperPane it closes this one.

        If the Dynamic implements Dynamic it will be informed about the stop (before it will be removed from the scene graph).

        Parameters:
        dynamic - The node (if Dynamic it will be informed) which shall be shown on top of the SuperPane
